skill.name: payload
skill.description: Use when working with Payload CMS projects (payload.config.ts, collections, fields, hooks, access control, Payload API). Use when debugging validation errors, security issues, relationship queries, transactions, or hook behavior.

security_audit.summary: Reviewed 12 documentation files. No credential access, exfiltration, or execution patterns were found. Examples use environment variables and sample fetch calls only.

content.value_statement: Payload CMS setup can be complex. This skill provides proven patterns for collections, fields, hooks, access control, queries, and plugins.
actual_capabilities: Provide collection and field configuration patterns including drafts, uploads, and conditional fields
Explain hook usage, context flags, and transaction safety with req
Guide access control rules and Local API overrideAccess behavior
Outline query operators and REST and GraphQL usage
Show adapter setup for database, storage, and email providers
Describe plugin development patterns for fields, hooks, and admin UI components
limitations: Does not run or test code or access your project data
Examples are generic and may need version specific changes
Does not generate full apps or manage deployments

use_cases.title: Design collections fast
use_cases.description: Create collection schemas with fields, drafts, and uploads using ready patterns.

use_cases.title: Harden access control
use_cases.description: Define access rules and safe Local API usage for user scoped operations.

use_cases.title: Plan plugin structure
use_cases.description: Map plugin architecture, add hooks, and extend the admin UI safely.

prompt_templates.title: Create a collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Payload collection for posts with title, slug, author relationship, and draft status. Include key admin defaults.

prompt_templates.title: Add access control
prompt_templates.prompt: Design access control so admins see all posts and authors only see their own posts. Mention Local API overrideAccess guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Fix hook loop
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an afterChange hook that updates the same collection and loops. Suggest a safe pattern with context flags.

prompt_templates.title: Design a plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a Payload plugin that adds fields to collections, adds an admin action button, and registers a background job.

output_examples.input: How should I secure Local API queries for user requests in Payload CMS?
output: Use overrideAccess set to false when a user is present
Return row level filters for non admin roles
Keep admin operations separate from user scoped actions
Add tests for admin and author access paths

best_practices: State your Payload version and database adapter
List collection slugs and key field names up front
Confirm where access control must apply
anti_patterns: Requesting secrets or environment values from users
Using overrideAccess true for user initiated operations

faq.question: Is this compatible with Payload 3 and Next.js?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Payload 3 with Next.js native setup.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and explanations but does not run or test code.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Share your current config and it can suggest changes.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It only uses the information you provide.

faq.question: What if my hooks cause errors?
faq.answer: Describe the hook and context and you will get a safe fix pattern.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic CMS help?
faq.answer: It focuses on Payload specific APIs, config patterns, and pitfalls.
